TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 387

barker_notes.barker_summary: Bill for carpenter's labor and materials.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 387

div1.p: Bill for carpenter's labor and materials.

To work done on your Cupilo, viz Brought over_____________________________ 238. 82 1/2
Taking off and framing and finishing the roof Boarding up corners of Cupilo and Kitchen 46 feet at 25 cts pr foot________________________ 11. 50
Work done on sky-light sills______________________________________________ 1. 50
Making and putting up 60 feet of water conductors at 25 cts pr ft_________ 15. 00
To 3 days work done your windows__________________________________________ 7. 50
To 3 do myself and 2 boys on your fence_________________________________ 15. 00
To mending 1 table________________________________________________________ 1. 50
To 1 day 2 boys bringing up your boat_____________________________________ 2. 00
To surveying 3 lots_______________________________________________________ 3. 00
To making 1 tester________________________________________________________ 1. 00
To 2 days work in getting timbers and raiting your lot front______________ 15. 00
To amount paid for suit to bring poles for same___________________________ . 25
To 66 feet weather boarding at 3$ cts pr foot_____________________________ 2. 31
To 8 feet Inch pine plank at 4 cts________________________________________ . 32
To 15 feet cherry do. at 6 cts pr foot__________________________________ . 90 ________ 319. 60 1/2
Recd Mr Austins Note for the balance of this account in his note which when paid will be in full say fifty Nine Dollars
